title: Did Stalin really like cowboy movies? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, he did, as far as we know. Stalin enjoyed Western genre movies of his time - Chaplin’s comedies, cowboy movies with John Wayne, criminal and detective movies… Stalin liked movies in general and was a very opinionated critic and “script editor” of Soviet moviemaking. One thing he hated was any kind of eroticism, even a very mild one.

Cowboy movies are commercial, single-use products. Stalin loved something complicated, lengthy, monolithic and something done for thousands of years. Ivan Grozny, Alexander Nevsky - the epic movies, that is what Stalin loved. But after the WWII, Stalin did allow release of numerous German and Hollywood movies, including adventures of cowboys - because USSR needed cash to replenish its treasury. P/S - he did not, I did.
